title: Stoning resistance
data:
**Stoning resistance** is a [resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance") [property](/wiki/Property "Property") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and protects against the effects of [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
  - [1.1 Sources](#Sources)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Messages](#Messages)
- [4 References](#References)

## Description

- *Main article: [Stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning")*

Stoning resistance prevents the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") and [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that have the property from being affected by the stoning attacks and properties of the following monsters:

- [Cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") and [chickatrices](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice"), who can turn victims to stone with their touch attacks and hissing, their [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg"), bare-skin contact with their bodies, and bare-skin contact with their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or flesh from their [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin")
- [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa"), who can turn victims to stone with her [passive](/wiki/Passive "Passive") [gaze](/wiki/Gaze "Gaze") (for the hero only), as well as stoning anyone that consumes her corpse or tin

### Sources

Stoning resistance is a property that only occurs intrinsically in the following monsters:

- All [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemeses "Quest nemeses")

- All [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic") monsters

  - b [acid blobs](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob") and b [gelatinous cubes](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube")
  - j [spotted jellies](/wiki/Spotted_jellies "Spotted jellies") and j [ochre jellies](/wiki/Ochre_jellies "Ochre jellies")
  - D [yellow dragons](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon"), D [baby yellow dragons](/wiki/Baby_yellow_dragon "Baby yellow dragon") and the D [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon")
  - F [green molds](/wiki/Green_mold "Green mold")
  - N [black nagas](/wiki/Black_naga "Black naga") and N [black naga hatchlings](/wiki/Black_naga_hatchling "Black naga hatchling")
  - all [P](/wiki/Pudding_or_ooze "Pudding or ooze")

- all monsters capable of stoning:

  - c [chickatrices](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice") and c [cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")
  - @ [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa"), who is special-cased to resist all forms of stoning *except* her [reflected](/wiki/Reflected "Reflected") gaze[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- g [gargoyles](/wiki/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") and g [winged gargoyles](/wiki/Winged_gargoyle "Winged gargoyle")

- all [v](/wiki/Vortex "Vortex")

- all [y](/wiki/Light_\(monster_class\) "Light (monster class)")

- all [E](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental")

- W [wraiths](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith")

- X [xorns](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn")

- Z [skeletons](/wiki/Skeleton "Skeleton")

-   [ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") and   [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade")

- ' [stone golems](/wiki/Stone_golem "Stone golem") - other golems that are petrified will turn into stone golems

- & [sandestins](/wiki/Sandestin "Sandestin"), & [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex"), & [Death](/wiki/Death_\(monster\) "Death (monster)"), & [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence"), & [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine"), & [mail daemons](/wiki/Mail_daemon "Mail daemon"), and & [djinn](/wiki/Djinn "Djinn")

- : [lizards](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard"), whose meat can cure delayed stoning

The hero can only obtain stoning resistance through [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into any of the listed monsters that are valid polymorph forms. While many of these monsters are flagged as granting stoning resistance when their corpse or tin is eaten, there is [no actual feature implemented](/wiki/Deferred_feature "Deferred feature") that reads this flag.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 071d79dc](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/071d79dce2ad5b8ade17c4dedf6b57c18b273a59), *temporary* intrinsic stoning resistance can be granted by eating the corpse or tin of the following monsters: acid blobs, chickatrices, cockatrices, gargoyles, winged gargoyles, spotted jellies, ochre jellies, yellow dragons and their babies, green molds, black nagas and their hatchlings, green slimes, xorns, Medusa, lizards, and the Chromatic Dragon.

Extrinsic stoning resistance can be obtained by wearing [yellow dragon scales](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scales "Yellow dragon scales") or [yellow dragon scale mail](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scale_mail "Yellow dragon scale mail").

## Strategy

Turning into a monster with stoning resistance is a viable method to either prevent stoning when dealing with several footrices, or else to abort delayed stoning inflicted on the hero. Stoning-resistant monsters can also wield footrice corpses—beware if a hostile stoning-resistant monster picks one up!

## Messages

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The following messages are added via [commit 071d79dc](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/071d79dce2ad5b8ade17c4dedf6b57c18b273a59):

- You feel less concerned about becoming petrified.

  You obtained temporary stoning resistance.

- You no longer feel secure from petrification.

  Your temporary stoning resistance expired.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2180](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L2180)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Stoning resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Stoning resistance is a resistance property that appears in NetHack, and protects against the effects of stoning.

Contents

  • 1 Description
    • 1.1 Sources
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 References

Description

Main article: Stoning

Stoning resistance prevents the hero and monsters that have the property from being affected by the stoning attacks and properties of the following monsters:

  • Cockatrices and chickatrices, who can turn victims to stone with their touch attacks and hissing, their eggs, bare-skin contact with their bodies, and bare-skin contact with their corpses or flesh from their tins
  • Medusa, who can turn victims to stone with her passive gaze (for the hero only), as well as stoning anyone that consumes her corpse or tin

Sources

Stoning resistance is a property that only occurs intrinsically in the following monsters:

  • All quest nemeses
  • All acidic monsters
    • b acid blobs and b gelatinous cubes
    • j spotted jellies and j ochre jellies
    • D yellow dragons, D baby yellow dragons and the D Chromatic Dragon
    • F green molds
    • N black nagas and N black naga hatchlings
    • all P
  • all monsters capable of stoning:
    • c chickatrices and c cockatrices
    • @ Medusa, who is special-cased to resist all forms of stoning except her reflected gaze[1]
  • g gargoyles and g winged gargoyles
  • all v
  • all y
  • all E
  • W wraiths
  • X xorns
  • Z skeletons
  •   ghosts and   shades
  • ' stone golems - other golems that are petrified will turn into stone golems
  • & sandestins, & Juiblex, & Death, & Pestilence, & Famine, & mail daemons, and & djinn
  • : lizards, whose meat can cure delayed stoning

The hero can only obtain stoning resistance through polymorph into any of the listed monsters that are valid polymorph forms. While many of these monsters are flagged as granting stoning resistance when their corpse or tin is eaten, there is no actual feature implemented that reads this flag.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 071d79dc, temporary intrinsic stoning resistance can be granted by eating the corpse or tin of the following monsters: acid blobs, chickatrices, cockatrices, gargoyles, winged gargoyles, spotted jellies, ochre jellies, yellow dragons and their babies, green molds, black nagas and their hatchlings, green slimes, xorns, Medusa, lizards, and the Chromatic Dragon.

Extrinsic stoning resistance can be obtained by wearing yellow dragon scales or yellow dragon scale mail.

Strategy

Turning into a monster with stoning resistance is a viable method to either prevent stoning when dealing with several footrices, or else to abort delayed stoning inflicted on the hero. Stoning-resistant monsters can also wield footrice corpses—beware if a hostile stoning-resistant monster picks one up!

Messages

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The following messages are added via commit 071d79dc:

You feel less concerned about becoming petrified.
You obtained temporary stoning resistance.
You no longer feel secure from petrification.
Your temporary stoning resistance expired.

References

  1. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2180
